summary: A letter from defense attorneys Foy & Sepowitz LLC to the US Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case US v. Tova Noel, et al. The letter requests extensive discovery related to the video surveillance system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death, including details about system failures, maintenance, and specific footage of defendants and Epstein.

keyFacts: The defense is seeking extensive discovery on the MCC video surveillance system, including details about its installation, maintenance, failures, and replacement around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.

The letter references specific alleged misconduct by defendants Tova Noel and Thomas, including failing to perform inmate counts, sleeping on duty, and browsing the internet, and asks the government to pinpoint this conduct on specific video files.
There were reported video system failures on July 29, 2019 and August 8, 2019, and the system was replaced on or about August 12, 2019.
The defense requests all video surveillance of Jeffrey Epstein, including footage from before and after his alleged July 23, 2019 suicide attempt and footage capturing him on the system.
The document indicates an ongoing criminal case (19 cr 830) against MCC corrections officers Tova Noel and others related to falsifying records and failing to perform duties.
